pharmaceutical.title: Pharmaceutical Analysis
pharmaceutical.description: Pharmaceutical analysis using HPLC is critical for ensuring drug quality, safety, and efficacy throughout the drug development and manufacturing process. HPLC provides precise quantification of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), impurities, and degradation products. It plays a vital role in quality control, stability testing, and regulatory compliance. Modern pharmaceutical analysis demands high sensitivity, selectivity, and reproducibility to meet stringent regulatory requirements from agencies like FDA, EMA, and ICH.

HPLC enables accurate detection and quantification of pesticides, herbicides, pharmaceuticals, and industrial chemicals in environmental samples. It plays a crucial role in regulatory compliance, environmental impact assessments, and pollution control. Modern environmental analysis requires high sensitivity and selectivity to detect trace-level contaminants in complex matrices.

biochemistry.title: Biochemistry
biochemistry.description: Biochemical analysis using HPLC is fundamental for studying biomolecules including proteins, peptides, nucleotides, and metabolites. HPLC enables precise separation and characterization of complex biological mixtures, supporting research in proteomics, genomics, and metabolomics. It plays a crucial role in protein purification, peptide mapping, and enzyme kinetics studies. Modern biochemical analysis requires specialized columns and gentle separation conditions to maintain biomolecule integrity while achieving high resolution and reproducibility.

Modern clinical analysis requires high sensitivity, specificity, and throughput to support clinical trials and routine diagnostic testing while meeting regulatory requirements for clinical laboratories.
